Wanted to suggest to use by default shorcuts from XnVew:

Especially these:

Zoom out (make smaller)- (minus)

Rotate -90 lossless (JPEG) (counterclockwise)Ctrl+Shift+L (or) Ctrl+Left Arrow

replies.author: Aurélien
replies.message:
Gwenview uses KDE standard shortcuts wherever possible, hence shortcuts like ctrl++ and ctrl+- to zoom in and out.

Regarding navigation, default shortcuts are space/back-space, but I am considering (though it may be too late for 4.8) also adding support for phone/camera-like navigation, where if you haven't zoomed in an image, pressing left or right goes to the previous and next image, and if you zoom it scrolls the image. I was a bit reluctant to implement this as I don't like much the idea of a shortcut having different behaviors based on the zoom mode but people are so used to such navigation nowadays that it shouldn't be a problem.

replies.author: RalphB
replies.message:
You can configure shortcuts yourself -- I've been doing so for years now because I don't like the default key bindings. PgUp/PgDn still has problems, though, and there's even a bug report about this: https://bugs.kde.org/show_b....

Ralph
